john.brecht

john.brecht
2020-12-10 04:19
https://ddb.ac/campaigns/join/13924163070588507

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:23
I wanted to clarify one thing about how dndbeyond works with respect to purchased content. if you go into dndbeyond and click on the Sources menu, you?ll see all the possible D&D source books that exist digitally. if you click on one, you can see its table of contents, but can?t go any further unless you have access to it. you have access to it if you own it, or if you have a character in a campaign with someone who owns it. in our case, thanks to my friend that lurks in our campaign, you are in a campaign with someone who owns _everything_

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:24
but the better way to find info isn?t to go to the individual sourcebooks, it?s to go to the Game Rules menu. if you click on, e.g. a Class in that menu, the view you get is populated with all the options for that class that have been published in all the sources you have access to. so, e.g. if you go to Ranger in a browser in incognito mode:

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:24
https://www.dndbeyond.com/classes/ranger

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:25
you?ll see only two options below ?Ranger Archetypes?. but if you go when you?re logged in as your account that?s part of our campaign, you?ll see close to 10

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:26
those 10 are pulled in from some combination of Player?s Handbook, Xanathar?s Guide, Volo?s Guide, and Tasha?s Guide

john.brecht
2020-12-10 18:27
same goes for Races, Feats, Backgrounds, etc? so if you are not seeing something you expect to see, or just aren?t seeing much at all, you might not be logged in

john.brecht
2020-12-14 02:34
in terms of equipment, give yourself the default starting equipment for your class. then beyond that, consider yourself to have 350gp to spend on any equipment that can be found in the player?s handbook: https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/equipment

john.brecht
2020-12-14 02:36
I will be DMing some of you some special items your character starts with. To add those or any of the mundane things you buy, click the `Manage Equipment` button you?ll see in the EQUIPMENT tab of your character sheet

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:08
Can you explain tool proficiencies in some more depth?

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:09
So like ? I have thieves tools. Does that mean I can like? pick locks? Even though I don?t have any such official skill?

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:10
so two things here - having Thieves Tools physically is one thing. but being proficient in them is another.

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:10
In general I don?t understand how skill/proficiency checks work outside of the ~18 core skills

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:10
if you have proficiency in thieves tools, then yes you can pick locks with them

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:10
How do I get that proficiency?

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:10
I bet there?s a PHB chapter I missed

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:11
well, dndbeyond helps take care of that for you as you create your character in make selections. all your current proficiencies are in the bottom left corner of your character sheet

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:11
Armor, Weapons, Tools, Languages are the 4 kinds

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:11
ah ok

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:12
So right now Ghostface has proficiency in thieves tools, so he can in fact pick locks? (Unless I change my mind before tomorrow night.)

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:12
yep

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:12
ok dope

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:13
I highly recommend this section of Xanathar?s Guide, it adds a lot more info to what is presented in the Player?s Handbook: https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/xgte/dungeon-masters-tools#ToolProficiencies

timwjones
2020-12-14 03:14
yeah i was looking at that :thinking_face:

john.brecht
2020-12-14 03:22
yep

john.brecht

timwjones
2020-12-14 05:32
OK I wrote my back story > A few things to know about Hill Giants. > > First? Hill Giants don?t have ?family?. Parenthood is vague and messy. The adults treat the children like a mob of obnoxious beggars.  > > Second? Hill Giants aren?t smart. When one of a clan?s brood is half the size of the others, nobody asks the obvious questions.  > > Questions like: Why is he so small? Is he doing ok? What happened to his face? > > Or: How does he make such elaborate toys from mere rocks and sticks? Why did our mess hall explode? > > Soon as I was old enough to run, I got the hell out of there. > > I met some Dwarves. Dwarves are reasonable. They liked my craftsmanship. I liked their iron-forges, and their ale. OK, mostly the ale. > > The Dwarves kept asking me my name. I tried to explain -- Hill Giants don?t have ?names?. The Clan just called me ?dar fhudish-cndiso?? meaning ?that boy with the fucked-up face.? > > Dwarves aren?t great at translation. So they just call me ?Ghost Face.?

john.brecht
2020-12-21 06:00
for those of you using Chrome or Firefox, I super recommend installing beyond20: https://beyond20.here-for-more.info/install

john.brecht
2020-12-21 06:01
it is a browser extension that helps integrate dndbeyond with roll20. e.g. when you click to roll something in ddb, the result displays in roll20

To join the video meeting, click this link: https://meet.google.com/oet-sixc-wrs Otherwise, to join by phone, dial and enter this PIN: 839 031 598# To view more phone numbers, click this link: https://tel.meet/oet-sixc-wrs?hs=5

john.brecht
2020-12-29 08:28
good session everybody! I would still like to encourage everybody to learn what your character can do. this means please read up on your Actions, Spells, and everything in your Features & Traits section. then in case you are unfamiliar with 5e rules, pleas check out, at minimum the sections on ?Using Ability Scores? (https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/using-ability-scores), and Combat (https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/combat) as well as the sections on your race and class. Thanks!

john.brecht
2020-12-29 08:29
if you are a spellcaster, please also read the section on Spellcasting - https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/spellcasting

john.brecht
2020-12-29 08:31
if you can?t follow these links, lemme know, it means I need to fix something in content sharing

timwjones
2020-12-29 19:53
:point_up_2: this is good advice, i realized i have literally twice as many prepared spells as i thought i did. (i was confusing my spells-prepared count with my spell-slots count!)

john.brecht
2020-12-29 21:09
what we?ve done so far is Challenge Rated for 1st-2nd level to give you guys a chance to ease into learning your characters? abilities. what is coming up next is fully 3rd level challenges, so you?ll need to be making use of all of your characters? capabilities starting next week

john.brecht
2020-12-29 21:10
starting at 3rd level is a lot to absorb relative to starting at 1st.

john.brecht
2020-12-29 21:15
sometime between now and next Wednesday, I?m happy to run an out-of-game combat session for an hour to go over how combat works, particularly actions and spellcasting in combat. if you?re interested let me know and we can do it monday or tuesday.

john.brecht
2020-12-29 22:41
posted some hopefully helpful quick-reference cards in #handouts (formerly #maps)

musicgracenotes
2020-12-29 22:52

moyerillustration
2020-12-29 22:53

john.brecht
2020-12-29 22:56
good! even though characters will probably just use the Attack or Cast Spell action 90% of the time, having the other Action options at your fingertips is important.

john.brecht
2020-12-29 23:00
yeah, lots of great ones out there! I love Web DM: https://www.youtube.com/c/WebDM/videos

timwjones
2020-12-29 23:10

timwjones
2020-12-29 23:10
even beyond the basic mechanics, they often have ideas for unconventional ways to use the powers, e.g. combos, that can be inspiring and interesting

musicgracenotes
2020-12-29 23:13

john.brecht
2020-12-29 23:16
also, notice that literally everything in your dndbeyond character sheet is clickable. whether it?s a skill, ability, class feature, spell, or anything else, if you click it you get the explanation and rules for it

john.brecht
2021-01-14 02:54
nat 20 on Persuasion

john.brecht
2021-01-14 07:50
https://www.dndbeyond.com/feats

john.brecht
2021-01-14 17:57
good times last night! so re: Feats, you can browse them in that link above. note that some of them are race-specific. (there are not currently and Goliath- or Aasimar-specific Feats though). also note that many of them still give a single point ability score increase and a minor feat ability. so you can either get 2 ability points, one great feat, or a lesser feat with 1 ability point increase.

john.brecht
2021-01-14 18:01
let me know if you?d like help with the choice. there are some Feats that sound cool but might be rarely actually used in practice, whereas a simple Ability Score Increase is constantly used in practice, so let?s make sure if you do take a Feat instead, that it?s one that will work out for you!

john.brecht
2021-01-14 21:47
also, re: the channels, in case anybody?s wondering - I like to use a #campaign channel for stuff that actually happens (or happened or will happen) in-game, and the #general channel is for game-related/meta-game stuff like scheduling, talking about rules, or any general bullshitting

musicgracenotes
2021-02-06 01:35
I don?t retain things I?ve learned by reading as much as by experiencing, so I couldn?t even form questions until now. Feels like we?re gonna get some serous traction! Another big question- I gathered last game that we don?t know what an enemy rolled in initiative until the first round happens. Felt extra spicy to be deciding what to do, not knowing when the enemy will respond. Is that true every top of initiative?

john.brecht
2021-02-07 20:52
catching up on all this, my game was ramping up Friday night as this good convo started

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:12
yes, I think it?s fair tp announce what the enemy?s initiative will be in advance. i?ll try to get your opponents into turn order more. I?ve not done it with this side adventure because I haven?t full prep?d it in roll20. I spent a while building all the lighting in and never got round to doing the tokens properly

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:24
I just wanted to know if that was a normal thing I simply didn?t know about. It?s was a little exhilarating to not know, though not to our advantage as players.

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:40
it?s in a gray zone. you also, e.g., don?t know their armor class or hit points at first

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:44
but there?s an argument that characters? general ?combat sense? might tip them off as to what the opponents? initiative is

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:45
initiative is really one of the least ?realistic? parts of combat

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:45
as is combat happening in rounds at all

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:45
so anyway, it?s DM?s prerogative

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:45
Ohhhh yes I?ve been slowly getting that. It?s like real life- one doesn?t know much about a stranger, like how many hits it takes for a smack down.

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:46
there is a specific Fighter ability that they gain at higher levels,

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:46
I think one of my main question is whether I would know basic hip point ranges for characters. Take an ogre for example I?m under the impression that all the other players know that they?re in the 50 to 75 point range, and I?m totally clueless. Or? It?s possible that no one knows just like me, but they know that they?re not supposed to know

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:46
after studying someone for 1 minute, they can deduce something about them

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:46
hit points, ac, level, etc..

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:47
yeah, keeping that knowledge separate is tricky

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:47
but I think it is fair of you to ask

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:47
to at least ask the other players

john.brecht
2021-02-07 21:48
and you can ask the DM, and I might say that this is a creature you?d have seen in combat before and may know something about

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:53
Sizing up an enemy makes sense - if a robber had a gun versus a bat, I would be playing out multiple options for attack and defense. but in DnD I don?t know what anything means.

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:58
Random example- if I had to choose to end up closer to one enemy or another, I wouldn?t know if I should be near someone with a sword or nearer to a sorcerer. I don?t really know the difference in how affective class types are against me or I am against class types. Or races. Is there something I should be able to read about, or is this a general handle one gets through experience?

timwjones
2021-02-07 21:58
you can ask the DM in those terms too ? in general DMs are justifiably cautious about answering meta-game mechanic questions like ?how many HP does it have??? but DMs usually love answering in-game questions like ?have i fought something like this before? do i have a sense of how hard it is to kill? how worried am i??

timwjones
2021-02-07 21:59
to that question, i think it?s a little of both ? you?ll learn more as you play more ? but feel free to ask questions of the DM and fellow players as you?re playing ? JB will put the kibash on it if we are meta-gaming too much

timwjones
2021-02-07 21:59
(and JB should feel free to edit/contradict anything I just said :stuck_out_tongue: )

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 21:59
Ooooooooo! This is the kind of thing I love to know- how to ask/what to ask

john.brecht
2021-02-07 22:14
yeah, meta-gaming is a tricky area

john.brecht
2021-02-07 22:14
but I am going to be very flexibly about it in this game

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 22:30
I definitely appreciate the flexibility, and I also want to know the ?real? way to do things.

musicgracenotes
2021-02-07 22:39
Watching CriticalRole has been helpful to get a sense of how professional players would ask. Aaaand their finesse is so great that it?s hard to see the seams, which is how I learn fastest.

2021-02-28 03:18
Tim decided to change his choice of armor on the basis of the time it takes to put it back on when something happens in the night. If anybody wants a little more info on that, here are the two sections of the rules I?ll be using for that: ? https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/equipment#GettingIntoandOutofArmor ? https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/xgte/dungeon-masters-tools#Sleep (scroll down to ?Sleeping in Armor?)

john.brecht
2021-02-28 03:19
that may or may not be exactly consistent with how I ruled that night, but that?s what I am committing to going forward

john.brecht
2021-03-03 20:15
went down a long rabbit hole of trying to understand mounted combat in D&D 5E last night, particularly when using the battlemap/grid system. it?s stupid complicated, so to make it easier I am just going to treat you guys as centaurs if you decide to ride a horse into a fight.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-03 20:17
I was spiraling down the same rabbit hole.... most recently watched a vid explaining it, but mostly they basically said to have the FEAT Mounted Combatant, and to keep a Feather Fall in your back pocket, if you plan to fly while mounted. And that being a flying mount makes you the first target to giants or other foe. Hrmph

john.brecht
2021-03-03 20:19
oh yeah, flying is a whole nother level. we?ll work on riding first.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-03 20:33
Yes, right! Well they still made it sound like Mounted Combatant was rather necessary to be protected while mounted, though being a Paladin does help w the Find Steed. Is taking a feat only a leveling up thing in particular levels, or is that something that can also be warranted in play or executed by the DM? I can?t yet tell when things are optional versus in the PHB, therefore done to the letter.

john.brecht
2021-03-03 20:34
Feats can be take as an alternative to Ability Score Increases

john.brecht
2021-03-03 20:36
the Mounted Combatant feat gives three things: ? advantage on melee attacks against unmounted creature smaller than your mount ? force attacks that target your mount to target you instead ? improvements when mount makes Dex saving throws

john.brecht
2021-03-03 20:38
all that said, I?ll probably require Animal Handling checks to get a non-warhorse to charge into anything obviously dangerous, as well as to stay there

musicgracenotes
2021-03-03 22:24
ohhhh?.that makes sense. Unless you recommend otherwise, I?m totally down for a warhorse.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-03 22:25
for Find Steed

musicgracenotes
2021-03-03 22:25

2021-03-03 22:26

john.brecht
2021-03-03 22:26
you are the only one that started the campaign with a warhorse

john.brecht
2021-03-03 22:27
well, any horse at all for that matter, but yeah, yours is a warhorse

john.brecht
2021-03-03 22:28
in fact, you should add it to your character sheets. go to the Extras tab, then use Manage Extras

timwjones
2021-03-14 23:57
random suggestion ? what would y?all think about moving our game to 6-10pm instead of 7-11pm? I?ve noticed folks are often real sleepy by the end of our sessions! Personally I am a night-owl so I don?t mind going til late. But Greg mentioned to me that he has trouble staying awake and engaged past 10. Thought I?d raise the question in case the rest of y?all feel similarly.

john.brecht
2021-03-15 00:05
yeah, thanks for bringing this up tones! my weeknight bedtime is a bit later than this, so I never blinked at 11, but I am happy to bump the schedule up an hour if that is better (and livelier?) for all. or maybe even just a half hour shift, if 6PM is too tight relative to work schedules.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-15 17:30
was thinking the same thing. 11pm is too late, as i get up with kids at 6:45am every day. I was gonna actually ask: if 7pm is fixed, could we pull back to 3 hours? I definitely see how it can sometimes just be getting into a groove by the third hour, but it?s a week night. In my mind, the standard for DnD is JB?s Fri night game, which can go on anywhere from 3-midnight, but we don?t have the same luxury of being a weekend.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-15 17:31
to be clear, I am a night owl-- I just have to get up early, too.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-15 17:42
to be clearer, I?m happy to start at 6 or 6:30p. my statement about 3 hours was only if starting at 7p was fixed for people?s work skej..

gregorybarlow
2021-03-18 03:03
? Animate Dead: It?s a stretch, but your undead minions could use the Help action to give you advantage on an attack. ? Blindness/Deafness: This spell can make it easier to hide your attacks and gain advantage. ? Conjure Minor Elementals: It?s a stretch, but your elemental minions could use the Help action to give you advantage on an attack. ? Darkvision: Use in total darkness against enemies that lack darkvision. If you can see them but they can?t see you, it?s sneaking time. ? Faerie Fire: Target foes to make them glow and give you advantage. Faerie Fire can be learned through Drow innate spellcasting. ? Find Familiar: Familiar can use the Help action! ? Grease: Trip em and gut em. ? Greater Invisibility: You?ll still need to use your bonus action to Hide, but you?ll probably succeed. ? Hold Person: You?ll actually critically hit anyone that is paralyzed by this spell. ? Hypnotic Pattern ? Invisibility: You?ll still need to use your bonus action to Hide. ? Sleep: They can?t see you coming if they?re snoozing. ? Tasha?s Hideous Laughter: While they fall prone laughing, you start stabbing! ? True Strike: Usually useless but has potential purpose here. Probably pick this as a last resort, or if you like making useless things useful. ? Web: Make them a silky coffin as you restrain them to gain advantage.

musicgracenotes
2021-03-18 03:07
Since you?re sharing what gives you advantage, would you also restate the physical conditions that give you advantage?

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:44
I?m gonna recommend everyone (except Greg) reread the ?spellcasting? section of your class descriptions. we have 4 casters in the group, so each of you does it differently, but just similarly enough to cause confusion. (well, 1 caster and 3 half-casters).

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:45
each kind of caster has a slightly different variation on the spells they Know, spells they have prepared, spell slots, spell slot recovery, and acquisition & swapping of spells with level advancement

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:47
it?d be great if your knowledge could reinforce each other, but unfortunately these little variations actually means your knowledge conflicts with each other :confused:

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:48
really you?re all a bunch of weirdos, not a single generic boring D&D class amongst ya!

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:54
this may be handy too: https://www.dungeonsolvers.com/2019/04/12/a-beginners-guide-to-dd-5e-spellcasting/

john.brecht
2021-03-20 19:59
artificers break the full caster/half caster distinction in that they have spells right away at first level like a full caster, but have the slower spell slot acquisition and 5th level spell ceiling of a half caster.

gregorybarlow
2021-03-21 15:10
If I can hide (which I can also do behind any of you guys), if one of you is within 5 ft of the enemy, if the enemy is prone, stunned, paralyzed, or sleeping, AND during mounted attack-- so I get advantage if I'm attacking from my pony!!!

gregorybarlow
2021-03-21 15:16
(***I think mounted combat advantage is only from melee attack; also I think we all could get it... I wish I had remembered this when we were fighting the orcs :sweat_smile::man-facepalming::skin-tone-2:)

john.brecht

2021-04-12 03:21

john.brecht
2021-04-12 03:24

john.brecht
2021-04-12 03:27
beyond that. I would encourage you to read up on your specific character class description in DnD Beyond, as well as to look at the Actions section of your character sheet in DnD beyond, which gives you some breakdown on what your options are

I had meant to start using the DM Inspiration system starting a few sessions back, and simply never did. so for now, I?m going to give you all a blanket Inspiration for your thorough investigations of Goldenfields prior to this attack. I know you were hoping to find info that would lead to fully preventing of heading off the attack, and the attack still happened, but you also made inroads with those NPCs that joined you in the battle, and played out your characters well in that whole process.

john.brecht
2021-04-15 16:43
I?ll remind everybody at the beginning of the next game, but the Inspiration button is just to the left of your hit points in DnD Beyond. If you click it, a sunrise icon should appear

hans.nelsen
2021-04-15 17:55
what does inspiration do?

hans.nelsen
2021-04-15 17:56
never mind, i will look it up

timwjones
2021-04-15 17:57
> Inspiration is a rule the game master can use to reward you for playing your character in a way that?s true to his or her personality traits, ideal, bond, and flaw? If you have inspiration, you can expend it when you make an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. Spending your inspiration gives you advantage on that roll. https://dnd5e.info/beyond-1st-level/inspiration/

2021-04-15 17:57

musicgracenotes
2021-05-12 21:31
I?ve been waiting for someone else to chime in and then I would add a little part I know, but i think that person is usually Tones. :grimacing: We spent the week doing each our own thing. We were directed to visit a merchant in the passing market, and he heavily endowed us with $1000gp (yehhhh we?re awesome), and a magical item for each of us. Medda took a pair of fancy boots, Nords took a shooty thing?, maybe Muldoon got something shiny? I took a shield :shield:, naturally. I think GF got a skirt or an apron or something. I had a vision and went out to seek my true equine companion, Steely Daniel. I decked Dan out in a saddle so fine, with silver threads running the length of the leather. We decided to strike down the manticore on our way north to contact the Druid to see about awakening trees in a responsible way. The barge, though eventless, cost 5gp. As we approached the open plains of grass near the hills, we noticed a terrible murder of corvids and carrion circling, blackening the sky like I?ve never seen before! Death was ringing the air. We approached carefully, only to find a battlefield of fallen bodies. They were obviously servants of evil, being orcs, bugbears, and two hill giants. I would have slain them myself! Nords noticed some slinking, bloody-mouth canines in the shadows, though most of us we clueless. What's next? Find out I. Then next episode of: The Fearsome Five! ...The Fantastic Five! ....the... :hankey: The Shit Slingers!

2021-05-12 21:34

2021-05-12 21:35

musicgracenotes
2021-07-13 06:21
WiFi is great here. Wed will be easy peasy. I?d prefer Sun or Mon. Sunday could be great until 9p. Mon is pretty good. Wednesdays are either mid work week in an exhausting way, or mid travel during the summer. (I only work Sundays right now!) I would love maybe every 5th or 6th week to take a week off. Every week for the juicy connection w my character and my fellow adventurers is best ...and I need a week off now and then to stir it up. Grace is chaotic good, not lawful like her Paladin. I prefer to act on impulse! I?m happy to do something else with y'all or just have the night ?off?. Viva la varieté!

timwjones
2021-07-13 16:34

moyerillustration

timwjones
2021-07-15 03:37
Leaving a note here for JB and I to discuss later: the Homunculus "channel magic" ability is technically a Reaction, not a normal Action! I'm sure what that means for the action economy. :thinking_face:

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:12
I think this means that when you cast the spell (whether it costs you an action, bonus action or reaction to cast) the Homunculus can use its reaction to Channel it to whatever location the Homunculus is at

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:13
so the implication for action economy is that the Munc needs to have not yet taken a reaction (e.g. an attack of opportunity) on this round

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:14
in fact, since no other Reactions are listed in that description, an attack of opportunity is the only other possible Reaction that Munc can take

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:15
the big thing to remember is the spell you cast has to have a range of touch

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:16
which of the spells you currently happen to have prepared, only includes Mending or Identify

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:18
but you could use it to cast, e.g. Cure Wounds at a distance, which is pretty dope

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:20
or do Shocking Grasp for the old R2-D2 attack?

timwjones
2021-07-15 05:20
ok cool that makes sense

john.brecht
2021-07-15 05:22
yeah, Cure Wounds is the sort of best case use of it, as normally to heal at a distance you have to use Healing Word, which heals less

2021-08-10 03:20
in the UA ?Draconic Races?, there are basically three new alternate Dragonborn types - ?Chromatic Dragonborn?, ?Gem Dragonborn?, and ?Metallic Dragonborn?

john.brecht
2021-08-10 03:21
vs in the core rules, there?s the plain vanilla Dragonborn, the Draconblood Dragonborn, and Ravenite Dragonborn

currently Muldoon is built using the Draconblood Dragonborn

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 01:08

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:01
Last night we were wondering whether temporary hp can stabilize the dying. The answer, per Players Handbook: > If you have 0 hit points, receiving temporary hit points doesn't restore you to consciousness or stabilize you. They can still absorb damage directed at you while you're in that state, but only true healing can save you.

moyerillustration
2021-08-12 17:01
good thing Saint Muldoon saved the day

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:01
peace be unto her

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 17:02
St Mouldy for the goldy! :first_place_medal:

gregorybarlow
2021-08-12 17:07
Also curious-- can someone at zero hit points sustain further damage / be further maimed by an opponent?

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:08
_*Damage at 0 Hit Point*s. If you take any damage while you have 0 hit points, you suffer a death saving throw failure. If the damage is from a critical hit, you suffer two failures instead. If the damage equals or exceeds your hit point maximum, you suffer instant death._

gregorybarlow
2021-08-12 17:09
:exploding_head:

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:10
so 5th Edition doesn?t have _negative_ hit points, like previous editions did. (where 0hp = unconscious and bleeding 1 hp/round, and 10hp = actual death). instead, whatever damage you take that would reduce you to 0 or worse just brings you down to zero

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:10
So yeah -- that sounds like if our fire giant friend had wanted to attack Amaris' body, he could have Instant Deathed her

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:10
and then you start making those death saves

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:10
oh interesting

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:11
however, if the ?overkill? is equal to or greater than your max hp, then that is instant death

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:11
and all that overkill damage needs to be dealt in one attack? or can it be cumulative over a few attacks?

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:11
e.g. - if your max hp is 50, and you are at 10hp, and then take a 60hp fireball, you instantly die

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:11
because of the excess 50hp

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 17:11
I predict we?ll need to do some formation work, as I did back in Asguard, to circulate healing to me so I can keep taking it like a super tank.

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:13
So, that sounds like: ? Amaris has 60HP max. Let's imagine she's down to zero, ? If she is attacked for 60HP, then she gets Instant Death. ? If she is attacked twice for 30HP, she does not Instant Death. (However she does take two saving-throw failures, which is bad.)

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:14
correct

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:14
cool

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:14
whenever someone dies on critical role, i'm used to watching everyone freaking out while they role all these savings throws. but never entirely understood the actual rules.

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:15
they very weirdly gamified this particular part of the game

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:15
but yeah, it does add some excitement to this sort of death struggle

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:16
instead of just simply, linearly, bleeding out to -10hp like in the olden days

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 17:16
Also, I could taken an opportunity attack and not gotten flanked, taken a turn to heal 30 pts on my own, return to slay.

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:16
ah nice

musicgracenotes

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:25
youre becoming much better at melee than the rest of us. if ghost ever needs to attack someone up-close i'm gonna be completely clueless.

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:26
don?t forget, you can take an action to Disengage or to Dodge

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:28
that said, if you are currently surrounded by enemies, take a Disengage to avoid the Opportunity attack, and then take a regular movement, only to move somewhere else that they also can, you may just find yourself re-surrounded

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 17:28
And miss the action??

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:29
yes, your action is spent to Disengage, so you wouldn?t then be able to, e.g. Dash

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:29
so unless your base movement is more than theirs, you run that risk

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:30
so that?s where you think tactically, make sure you retreat to a more defensible spot

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:30
e.g. with your back to a wall, or next to an ally

musicgracenotes
2021-08-12 17:30
Duuude they?ll just throw a fucking rock at me and my armored ass can?t even move a foot to the right.

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:30
or, you find a way to move a way they can?t

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:31
this was a problem you guys were going to run into eventually, having a single melee combatant and everyone else missile attackers

john.brecht
2021-08-12 17:31
when it?s hordes of goblins, it?s less of a deal

timwjones
2021-08-12 17:31

john.brecht
2021-08-12 19:15
the Aid spell is a very nice buff that 3 of you have access to and that can be overlooked. rather than Temp hit points, it boosts your max hit points for a full eight hours.

2021-08-12 19:16
https://www.dndbeyond.com/spells/aid

john.brecht

we are using RAW'

john.brecht
2021-08-12 21:19
which is death saving throws when you are reduced to zero hit points

john.brecht
2021-08-12 21:20
with Instant Death applying when massive damage is taken

john.brecht
2021-08-12 21:20
https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/basic-rules/combat#Droppingto0HitPoints

john.brecht
2021-08-12 21:21
?When damage reduces you to 0 hit points and there is damage remaining, you die if the remaining damage equals or exceeds your hit point maximum.?

john.brecht
2021-08-12 23:17
just referring to the level 14 thing. there is one sorcerer feature to look forward to before then. otherwise, it?s all about getting access to those higher level spells!

john.brecht
2021-08-12 23:22
wizard has a similar progression, sparse on class features, so it?s all about those spells

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:37
@musicgracenotes :

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:38
WotC = Wizards of the Coast, publishers of D&D

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:38
Spelljammer = a campaign setting that came out in the early 90s. it was sort of Space D&D

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:39
like a Spelljammer is a ship, that looks more like a naval ship than space ship, but it could fly through ?realmspace?

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:41
5th Edition has used the Forgotten Realms setting by default, and it?s always been the classic campaign setting

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:42
Eberron was the other campaign setting for 5E, it?s more of a steampunk thing

john.brecht
2021-10-11 21:45
https://www.enworld.org/wiki/dnd_settings/

john.brecht

and yeah Milestone leveling glosses over all the experience point accounting in favor of just leveling at major plot milestones

john.brecht
2021-11-16 23:14
so I can basically start doing some montaging and just describe what happens in order to fast forward to those major plot points

gregorybarlow
2021-11-16 23:22
yeah i just figured we can only get through those milestones so quickly

gregorybarlow
2021-11-16 23:22
im pretty lost in the plot now as it is :joy:

gregorybarlow
2021-11-16 23:22
but i feel like that

gregorybarlow
2021-11-16 23:22
's on brand for Medda

john.brecht
2021-11-16 23:23
yeah, Milestoning isn?t any faster or slower. it?s just an approximation.

john.brecht
2021-11-16 23:29
but what I can do to make things faster is montage some stuff. e.g. I would take that month or so of real time we spent exploring and role-playing in Yartar and compress it to a few salient things and otherwise me describing some stuff that happened off-camera and do it all in a single night

was referring to sorcerers regaining spell slots on short rest

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:34
oh! i?m mixing up sorcerers and warlocks

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:35
warlocks regain them on short or long rest (though they don?t have very many to begin with, so makes sense)

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:38
I wanted to clarify a ruling last night, that I didn?t want to interrupt momentum for at the time (and it was fun in the moment):

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:39
Perceiving through your familiar?s senses requires an action. Consequently, you can?t cast a spell while seeing through the familiar?s senses.

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:40
or in this case, can?t use Psychic Whispers, since Psychic Whispers requires an action to establish

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:41
also, somewhat related (but doesn?t actually apply here, since Psychic Whispers isn?t a spell) - no matter what else, targeting someone with a spell requires a ?Clear Path to the Target?

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:41
https://www.dndbeyond.com/sources/phb/spellcasting#AClearPathtotheTarget

john.brecht
2022-03-17 03:43
so, if they are obscured by magical darkness but you can see through that magical darkness, then you can target them. but if they are obscured by being completely behind a wall, you can?t target them even if you can ?see? them with something like _Scrying_

timwjones
2022-03-17 16:03
Also leaving this here so I wont get confused next time. When Ghost channels a spell through a munc: 1. Ghost spends one _Action_ to cast the spell 2. Optionally, Ghost often also spends one _Bonus Action_ to direct the Munc to do something (like fly closer to the spell's target) 3. Finally, the Munc (whose turn comes right after Ghost's) spends one _Reaction_ to channel the spell

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:02
Ok, the internet says when I use voice of the chain master it lasts at least until the beginning of my next turn, so in the future, could I enact VOTCM and then use psychic whisper at the beginning of my next turn?

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:03
Or if you think the connection lasts even longer than that, I'll take it :smile:

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:05
Both Buzz and Medda can see in magical darkness :nail_care:

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:06
Yeah I could use more short rests :thinking_face:

john.brecht
2022-03-17 21:07
yup, so that kind of targeting works, there just needs to still be a ?clear path?

john.brecht
2022-03-17 21:08
which in DnD terms means basically just air

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:09
(please see my other replies above, re: voice of the chain master)

gregorybarlow
2022-03-17 21:17
4. The Munc or Buzz can use their _Bonus_ _Reaction_ to flirt with each other or cast a touch-range mating spell.

john.brecht
2022-03-17 21:21
there is just the on Action per turn

john.brecht
2022-03-17 21:23
so on turn 1, you spend your action to see through the creatures eyes. that lasts until the beginning of your turn 2. (meaning during everyone else?s turn 1, and the turn 2 of anyone before you). then on the beginning of your turn 2, that effect ends, and during your turn 2 you have a new Action you can use

john.brecht
2022-03-30 17:18
question about my DMing style? it?s a truism that combat takes longer than expected in D&D, and DMs always overestimate what might get achieved in a session. this is a good thing, as it makes you plan ahead further, but? I feel like I _really_ overestimate what will happen in a night. that may just make me a bad estimator and that?s fine. but do you guys feel like there?s anything I can/should do differently to move things along faster? or is this pace feeling fine to you all?

john.brecht
2022-03-30 17:18
(or should I install some kind of anonymous tip jar plugin to Slack :thinking_face: )

moyerillustration
2022-03-30 17:22

john.brecht
2022-04-27 02:56
Potion of Healing (6) - 50gp Potion of Greater Healing (6) - 150gp Potion of Superior Healing (4) - 450gp Potion of Supreme Healing (1) - 1350 gp Elixir of Health (3) - 120gp Keoghtom?s Ointment (4 doses) - 120 per dose Potion of Heroism (1) - 180 Potion of Growth (1) - 270 Potion of Gaseous Form (1) - 300 Potion of Speed (2) - 400 Potion of Flying (2)- 500

john.brecht
2022-04-27 03:00
+1 Armor or +1 Shield - 1500gp +1 light crossbow +1 studded leather +1 shield Helm of Comprehend Languages - 500gp Wand of Magic Detection - 1500gp Chime of Opening - 1500gp Gloves of Missile Snaring - 3000gp

john.brecht
2022-04-27 03:13
*Helm of Comprehend Languages* _For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface on which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text._ _This spell doesn?t decode secret messages in a text or a glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn?t part of a written language._

john.brecht
2022-04-27 03:15
*Gloves of Missile Snaring* These gloves seem to almost meld into your hands when you don them. When a ranged weapon attack hits you while you?re wearing them, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier, provided that you have a free hand. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in that hand.

john.brecht
2022-05-23 22:41

john.brecht
2022-05-24 00:09
tonight I?m going to work on some kind of new policies for combat. with the growing number of minions, and at our average of 1/2-1 combat per session and 2 sessions/month, it could take us until sometime in 2023 to complete the next chapter of the campaign. possibilities include: ? if a player doesn?t have a plan ready when their turn comes around, they default to the Dodge action (unless something radically different has just happened to the battlefield that dashed their plan) ? a character and all of their minions go on the same initiative, ? I?ll still use the dndb combat tracker, as it helps me tremendously, but I will also see if I can display the roll20 one at the same time so folks can see when their turn is coming. I just have to see if I can keep beyond20 from sending all the monster names to roll20. (I?ll also do my best to point out who is on deck next, but please be planning your next turn as soon as your last one ends rather than when your next when begins) ? above all, I will continue to urge all of you to read up on how your class, subclass, spells, race, and feats work in advance of a game session

john.brecht
2022-05-24 00:09
there are a million articles out there on this subject. going to spend some time tonight reading some and boiling down to a set of policies to help us out. if any of you have any other suggestions, please DM them to me!

john.brecht
2022-05-24 04:40
OK this is what we?ll go with going forward: * know what you are going to do when your turn comes. if you don?t know: * use a default plan - a go-to attack or cantrip * otherwise, Help if possible * otherwise, Dodge * no steering another player?s turn (but can have a group discussion at the top of each round) * if you don?t know how an ability/spell/feature works, just don?t use it then. write a note to yourself to read up on it later, or look it up in time to use the next round. * roll attack and damage simultaneously * no more than 2 summons at a time. ?group? summons to be treated as one mob with one move and one attack * (DM) when it?s obvious the combat is going to end, just call it, end it narratively * (DM) boost enemy DPS rather than hp when a CR boost is needed * (DM) don?t use spell casters or script them out in advance
